New Records: The Dodgers became the second team ever to throw a nine-inning shutout using at least eight pitchers.
Before Wednesday, no team had ever thrown a postseason shutout in a game in which the starter recorded four or fewer outs.
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts hit a home run in the first inning.
Will Smith hit a 432-foot two-run homer in the bottom of the second.
Gavin Lux hit a three-run homer in the bottom of the seventh.
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers decided they'd be without their regular shortstop, Miguel Rojas.
The Dodgers figured they wouldn't have enough starting pitching to field a traditional four-man rotation in the playoffs.
Post-Match Reflections: Dave Roberts praised his team's resilience and desire.
Landon Knack expressed pride in the team's response.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers will have their two best starting pitchers, Yoshinobu Yamamoto and Jack Flaherty, lined up to start in Game 5.
Others: The series will return to Los Angeles for a winner-take-all Game 5.
